liftProblemCode

Class LiftThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • liftProblemCode.LiftThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class LiftThread
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This thread emulates the behaviour of the lift itself as it travels around and users press buttons on floors. This thread emulates the actual routing of lift - 500 mSec between a floor n * 500 mSec at a floor stop
    Author:
    Rob

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int HighestFloor
      a constant effectively - the highest floor that this lift goes to.
      private Lift lift
      Lift - a private member reference to the lift that this thread is controlling the movement of.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LiftThread(java.lang.String inLiftID)
      A constructor for the lift thread which takes and identifier for the lift.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void executeRandomWaitingPeriodAtFloor()
      The random period do waiting simulates how long the lift is at a floor, from a min to a max period - just like a real system.
      Lift getLift()
      a simple get method to return the lift for this thread.
      void run()
      The run method that periodically moves the lift between the floors - it waits a period of time to travel between floors, then sets the current floor.
      private void timePeriodtoTravel(int countofFloorsToGoPast)
      This method works out how long it will take to go between floors
      private void usersSelectFloors()
      This method lets a random number of separate floor selections be done.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LiftThread

        public LiftThread(java.lang.String inLiftID)
        A constructor for the lift thread which takes and identifier for the lift.
        Parameters:
        inLiftID - This is the identifier for the lift.

    • Method Detail

      • getLift

        public Lift getLift()
        a simple get method to return the lift for this thread.
        Returns:
        a lift

      • run

        public void run()
        The run method that periodically moves the lift between the floors - it waits a period of time to travel between floors, then sets the current floor. - releases that floor for the lift queue - allows user to select floors - and waits for random period of time for users to carry out their actions.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • usersSelectFloors

        private void usersSelectFloors()
        This method lets a random number of separate floor selections be done. If those selected floors are in the direction that lift is heading in, then it is added to the floor queue If the emulation simulates a user pressing a button in the reverse direction it is ignored. (just like real life)

      • executeRandomWaitingPeriodAtFloor

        private void executeRandomWaitingPeriodAtFloor()
        The random period do waiting simulates how long the lift is at a floor, from a min to a max period - just like a real system.

      • timePeriodtoTravel

        private void timePeriodtoTravel(int countofFloorsToGoPast)
        This method works out how long it will take to go between floors
        Parameters:
        countofFloorsToGoPast - Thi is an integer of the number of floors that we are traveling across.
